summary: Improve the app by adding a fully functioning Firebase backend with user authentication (Google Sign-In and email/password) and Firebase-based data storage via Firebase MCP.
architectural_notes: Use Firebase as the backend platform (Auth + data storage) leveraging Firebase MCP access.

existing_features.title: Wire the frontend React Query hooks to the real backend methods so that core flows no longer throw "Backend method not implemented" or return placeholder values.
Update authentication UX copy to reflect the supported authentication method (Internet Identity) and prevent the UI from implying Google Sign-In or email/password support.

Add a short in-app note (English) explaining that third-party authentication providers (Google/email-password) and Firebase are not used in this deployment, and that identity is managed via Internet Identity + canister storage.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement Firebase backend with user authentication (Google Sign-In and email/password)
Set up Firebase data storage for app data (using Firebase MCP access)

Implement a fully functioning Internet Computer backend data layer (Motoko, single-actor) to persist all app data currently stubbed in the frontend, using the authenticated caller Principal as the user identity.

projectName: Replace Firebase auth/data request with Internet Identity authentication and full Motoko data persistence
